title: What will happen to Fiddlesticks?
body:
As of now, the lore is or is in the process of being retconned. As far as I know, from what I've read, the League is gone. While this is sort of ironic, I'm wondering if this means the Institute of War has been removed as well, and if this is the case, what will happen to Fiddlesticks?

I can totally see him as being related to the Shadow Isles. His original lore states that his existence came about when a mage, a summoner named Istvaan hailing from Zaun, entered the chamber in the Insititue of War to commit to a super dark ritual. This is implied as the birth of Fiddlesticks. This also leaves me wondering whether or not Fiddlesticks is Istvaan, or if Fiddlesticks was summoned by Istvaan, upon which Fiddlesticks killed the mage immediately. 

This of course implies that he is not of the Shadow Isles. My only reasoning that he would be a SI champ is that he looks like he fits the scene. Also, I feel like he makes for a fun comp when paired with various shadow isle champs as well (Thresh Support, Maokai Top, etc). 

What are the community's and developer's thoughts on champs like Fiddle who seem to not have a real homeland, especially ones like Fiddle who have to be contained at all times unless they are on the fields of justice?

replies.body:
Hello! I'm currently the guy taking a crack at Fiddlesticks (still in the early stages, nothing concrete). For the current iteration I've decided to keep him separate from the Shadow Isles, if nothing more than to keep SI from being our Spooky Scary Champ megamart. Plus, I think he fits in better elsewhere anyway :)

One of the things I want to preserve is the core of Fiddle's personality, while expanding on his origins and purpose. I'm throwing in a bit of Lovecraft and Alice in Wonderland to the early drafts (I also took a couple suggestions from the forums), so hopefully the result is a bit of creepy absurdism with a hint of something-wicked-this-way-comes. We'll see if we end up using any of it, but I'm definitely trying to do him proud!

Awesome! I definitely agree - Fiddlestick's lore, in my mind, should be more like a spooky camping story (maybe even a little darkly humorous) rather than being a part of the gothic horror that is the Shadow Isles.

Cross-posting from [Nocturne's retcon thread](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/6EofhoHW-lets-talk-biographies):

I like the idea of Shaco, Fiddlesticks, and Nocturne being related somehow, at least where they came from. Not from the Void, not from the Shadow Isles; these places seem too "real" (relatively speaking).

These characters are the physical manifestations of humanity's dread.

The Void is at the separation of the alien and the familiar.

The Shadow Isles are at the separation of life and death.

Shaco, Nocturne, and Fiddlesticks came from the place at the separation of fiction and reality.

*Lore I made up for illustrative purposes:*

The world of ideas has no physical presence, but surely existed. Many theorized about visiting this place, but modern academics dismissed it as nonsense.

One night, a group of three sorcerers found an ancient text that seemed to describe a ritual that would open a portal to this world. Defying all rational thought, they sought to find it and control its power. After all, when one has control over reality, he is all-powerful. They performed the ritual during a mid-autumn's new moon, a particularly soul-shivering, frightful night where ideas of doom, darkness, and madness prevailed...

The sorcerers did not know what to expect. There was no portal, for ideas do not have a concrete form. Yet the sorcerers felt something heavy in the air regardless...

Thunder struck, and the ideas manifested themselves in each of the sorcerers, embracing their powers. The sorcerers' identities died that day, but their consciences remained. These beings, now known as Fiddlesticks, Nocturne, and Shaco, seek to rid themselves of this last shred of humanity that remains inside them...

I liked these ideas:

1. Fiddlesticks is guarding something

2. Fiddlesticks' origin is unknown, perhaps even to him, but he knows his purpose

3. Whatever fiddlesticks' purpose is, its either to
  a) prevent some evil from coming (maybe whatever he's guarding) or 
  b) protect something that is building up/biding its time to bring misery and doom to the Runeterra

Based on his quotes, what he is currently doing pre-retcon, and his quotes, I'd say he just likes toying with people. Sadistic as that might sound, he enjoys watching people run in fear and just flat out suffer before they die. For example, in his lore he never goes out of his way to kill anyone. Instead he just waits for people foolish enough to come near him so he can drive them mad before trying to kill them - after all, it was said few had lived entering where he stood and those who had were driven mad. There's no reason for him NOT to leave, there's certainly no reason for him TO leave. So he just sits there waiting for his next victim, eventually being used as an executioner.

If I were to see him under a new light outside of the old lore, I would put him as someone who just sits in one place. Some place that it's rumored that a dark magic was used or is supposedly haunted by a powerful mage driven mad. Everyone knows that the rumor is true - after all, how could you not know about a murderous scarecrow? However, Fiddlesticks would probably just be played off as a legend to try and forget what he's capable of. A murderous, sadistic, mind-games playing scarecrow with no mercy.
